overview:
Milo Yiannopoulos is founder and Editor-in-Chief of The Kernel, Europe’s new quality technology publication. He is a journalist and broadcaster living in London and San Francisco who writes about technology, entrepreneurship, society, religion and celebrity culture in the US and Europe.

Milo is a former technology columnist for The Telegraph and European reporter for TechCrunch. He was commissioning editor of The Telegraph’s Tech Start-Up 100. His work has also appeared in The Wall Street Journal, WIRED, Directors’ Guild of America Quarterly, the 500 Startups blog, Management Today, The Catholic Herald and many others.

He’s a regular speaker at tech conferences and an advisor to start-ups, particularly those operating in media, content, publishing, advertising and social networking. Milo was named in the 2011 WIRED Digital Power 100 as one of European technology’s ‘movers and shakers’¬ù and is a mentor for the 500 Startups and Springboard accelerator programmes.
